title: MUSIC INFORMATION RETRIEVAL ON REPRESENTATIVE MEXICAN FOLK VOCAL MELODIES THROUGH MIDI FEATURE EXTRACTION
author: Mario Alberto Vallejo Reyes (University of York)
background: Analyzing the characteristics of Mexican folk vocal melodies using MIDI feature extraction techniques, focusing on metrics such as ambitus, pitch-class entropy, and interval distribution.
contribution: This paper introduces a study of Mexican folk vocal melodies by employing MIDI feature extraction to analyze ambitus and entropy, revealing insights into compositional diversity.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods may have focused on western music traditions or lacked a comprehensive statistical analysis of folk music melodies.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work specifically targets Mexican folk music and applies MIDI analysis to extract unique musical features, offering insights that are culturally relevant.

key_innovation: Utilizes MIDI feature extraction to quantify and analyze intrinsic musical elements of diverse Mexican folk songs, contributing to the understanding of their musical structure.
real_world_impact: While this research adds to the academic understanding of Mexican folk music, its immediate application in technology or industry remains limited.
limitations: The study finds no significant correlation between musical features and song popularity on platforms like Spotify, which may limit practical insights regarding audience engagement.

new_terms.ambitus: **Ambitus** refers to the range of pitches that a melody spans, crucial for understanding vocal demands.
new_terms.pitch-class entropy: **Pitch-class entropy** is a measure of the unpredictability in the pitch usage of a musical piece, indicating melodic complexity.
new_terms.interval distribution: **Interval distribution** examines the frequency of intervals used within melodies, shedding light on compositional preferences.
